newsArray.title: England batter Ben Duckett out to seize his big chance to impress in the Caribbean after watching his 'tired' team-mates struggle at the World Cup
newsArray.description: EXCLUSIVE INTERVIEW BY LAWRENCE BOOTH: Duckett, who has been at the heart of England's Bazball revolution in Test cricket, intends to show what he can do in 50-over cricket.
newsArray.content: England batter Ben Duckett out to seize his big chance to impress in the Caribbean after watching his 'tired' team-mates struggle at the World Cup A new-look England will face the West Indies in three ODIs next month Ben Duckett hopes to add to the eight one-day caps he has won in seven years The 29-year-old has been at the heart of the Bazball revolution in Test cricket By Lawrence Booth for the Daily Mail Published: 20:01, 13 November 2023 | Updated: 20:37, 13 November 2023 e-mail View comments A refreshed Ben Duckett wants to take the Caribbean by storm next month after watching his ‚Äòtired‚Äô team-mates struggle at the World Cup in India . Duckett, who has been at the heart of England‚Äôs Bazball revolution in Test cricket, intends to show what he can do in 50-over cricket when a new four-year World Cup cycle begins with the first of three ODIs against West Indies in Antigua on December 3. And he believes the simplicity of his approach, which essentially remains unaltered whatever the format, will stand him in good stead as he looks to add to the eight one-day caps he has won since his debut in Bangladesh seven years ago. ‚ÄòI‚Äôve been a part of the best generation of England white-ball cricket and it‚Äôs been near to impossible to break into the team,‚Äô he told Mail Sport. ‚ÄòNow there‚Äôs an opportunity to go and get my place.‚Äô Managing director Rob Key said on Sunday he felt England‚Äôs one-day team had not been helped by comparisons with the aggressive Bazballers. And with many of the 30-somethings who have fallen so short in India being omitted from the trip to the Caribbean, a new-look one-day side will include the Test-match top three of Duckett, Zak Crawley and Ollie Pope. England batter Ben Duckett wants to take the Caribbean by storm next month Once, England used the one-day team as the route into Test cricket. Then, under Ben Stokes and Brendon McCullum, the Test side copied their one-day counterparts‚Äô aggression. Now, with Key observing that the 50-over team has gone away from the style that helped make England double white-ball world champions, it is as if the wheel has turned full circle. The 29-year-old Duckett hesitates to call himself young, but admits: ‚ÄòThe exciting brand that the likes of me, Zak and Popey play is exactly what England want in both formats. It will be an opportunity for some fresh faces to go and show what they can do. ‚ÄòI‚Äôve always found I don‚Äôt have a different gameplan for Test match, 50-over and T20. In the past I‚Äôd always say you just take a few more risks in T20, whereas now I‚Äôm running at Josh Hazlewood in a Test match on day one. ‚ÄòThere‚Äôs also Harry Brook, Will Jacks and Phil Salt - there are so many names. All those guys are playing a similar brand of cricket throughout the formats, which makes life a lot easier.‚Äô Duckett does not believe that the squad for the Caribbean spells the end for England‚Äôs Class of 2019, and says the selectors were always going to look elsewhere for a trip that starts so soon after the World Cup. He says he was told he was ‚Äòpretty close‚Äô to selection for the tournament himself, and found it ‚Äòtough‚Äô to watch England lose six games out of nine. The 29-year-old has been at the heart of England‚Äôs Bazball revolution in Test cricket ‚ÄòI‚Äôm sure the lads are more gutted than anyone,‚Äô he said. ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs a side that were good enough to go and win. I‚Äôm looking at half or three-quarters of that squad, and the timing being straight after the English summer. All the lads have been playing so much cricket. ‚ÄòI felt for them flying straight off at the end of the summer, with no break, going straight to a World Cup in India. It must have been incredibly hard, and there must have been tired bodies.‚Äô Duckett, by contrast, has had six weeks off after the end of a summer in which he opened in all five Ashes Tests and made an unbeaten 107 off 78 balls in an ODI against Ireland in Bristol. ‚ÄòI‚Äôve had a really nice break, and I feel fresh and ready to go.‚Äô Music, after the last few weeks, to English ears. India India Cricket Share or comment on this article: England batter Ben Duckett out to seize his big chance to impress in the Caribbean after watching his 'tired' team-mates struggle at the World Cup e-mail Add comment Comments 0 Share what you think No comments have so far been submitted. newsArray.title: World Cup 2023: Morne Morkel resigns as Pakistan bowling coach following team's disappointing performance
creator: PN Vishnu
newsArray.description: World Cup 2023: Morne Morkel resigns as Pakistan bowling coach following team's disappointing performance
newsArray.content: Cricket World Cup 2023: Morne Morkel resigns as Pakistan bowling coach following team's disappointing performance Morne Morkel had joined Pakistan cricket team on a six-month contract in June this year after finishing his assignment with IPL side Lucknow Super Giants. Press Trust of India November 14, 2023 00:03:38 IST Morne Morkel had joined the team on a six-month contract in June this year after finishing his assignment with IPL side Lucknow Super Giants. AP Lahore: Former South African pacer Morne Morkel on Monday resigned as the Pakistan cricket team‚Äôs bowling coach without completing his contract and two days after the team‚Äôs elimination from the World Cup in India. World Cup 2023: News | Schedule | Results | Points table The Babar Azam-led Pakistan lost five of the nine matches in the ODI showpiece event, losing the last match to England by 93 runs in Kolkata. Related Articles World Cup 2023: Pakistan have not been paid for five months, claims Rashid Latif World Cup 2023: What are Pakistan's semi-final chances after beating Bangladesh? Morkel had joined the team on a six-month contract in June this year after finishing his assignment with IPL side Lucknow Super Giants. His first assignment with the Pakistan team was its tour of Sri Lanka for a two-Test series. ‚ÄúPakistan Cricket Board will announce his replacement in due course. Pakistan‚Äôs next assignment is a three-match Test series against Australia scheduled to take place from December 14, 2023, to January 7, 2024, in Australia,‚Äù the PCB said in a statement on Monday. Former fast bowler Umar Gul is tipped to replace Morkel as he has worked before with the national team on an interim basis and has also coached the Afghanistan team. Pakistan failed to qualify for the semifinals after finishing fifth, which led to several former cricketers demanding wholesale changes in the side, including the removal of Babar Azam as skipper . Pakistan suffered losses against India, Australia, South Africa, England and a shock defeat at the hands of Afghanistan. Join our Whatsapp channel to get the latest global news updates Published on: November 14, 2023 00:03:38 IST Tags: Cricket Morne Morkel Pakistan Cricket Team World Cup 2023

newsArray.title: World Cup 2023: We have the right bowlers to exploit different conditions, says India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey
creator: PN Vishnu
newsArray.description: World Cup 2023: We have the right bowlers to exploit different conditions, says India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey
newsArray.content: Cricket World Cup 2023: We have the right bowlers to exploit different conditions, says India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey ‚ÄúIn terms of the different skills, we have the ability to (take on) whatever challenge that is ahead of us. Maybe different surfaces, we have the bowlers to do that. And we‚Äôve done it,‚Äù India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey said. FirstCricket Staff November 13, 2023 23:41:56 IST Paras Mhambrey was all praise for Jasprit Bumrah, calling him a "lethal" bowler. AP India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey believes that the hosts have the right bowlers who can be effective on different conditions and surfaces. World Cup 2023: News | Schedule | Results | Points table The Indian bowlers have taken the 2023 World Cup by storm so far, with the pace trio of Mohammed Shami, Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj sharing 45 wickets between themselves. Apart from the pacers, Ravindra Jadeja (16 wickets) and Kuldeep Yadav (14 wickets) have also been equally impressive. Related Articles World Cup 2023: Team India reach Mumbai ahead of semi-final against New Zealand; Coaching staff inspects Wankhede pitch World Cup 2023: Hardik Pandya ruled out of tournament; Prasidh Krishna named replacement India‚Äôs impeccable bowling attack has helped the hosts remain unbeaten in the World Cup so far, having clinched nine wins in as many matches. ‚ÄúIn terms of the different skills, we have the ability to (take on) whatever challenge that is ahead of us. Maybe different surfaces, we have the bowlers to do that. And we‚Äôve done it,‚Äù Mhambrey told ICC following India‚Äôs 160-run win over Netherlands on Sunday. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre the only team who are going to play in nine different venues. So for us, it‚Äôs nine different surfaces, nine different challenges. ‚ÄúSo, we have the right bowlers to exploit these conditions, and they‚Äôve shown that. All of them on a given day can win a game for their country,‚Äù stated Mhambrey. Mhambrey went onto term Jasprit Bumrah as a ‚Äúlethal‚Äù bowler whereas he complemented Shami‚Äôs seam bowling. ‚ÄúBoom (Bumrah) is a very different action. Just look at the way he‚Äôs come back to the game (from injury). The set of skills, the unique action. He completely beats you. Now, he‚Äôs got both. He gets the ball in and gets the ball out. He‚Äôs become lethal,‚Äù the coach said. ‚ÄúShami is someone who has the seam (that hits) straight upright. You never know when Shami hits that seam, which way it‚Äôs going to come,‚Äù added the 51-year-old. Mhambrey also noted Siraj‚Äôs versatility, saying: ‚ÄúSiraj has really kind of grown in the last couple of years. He‚Äôs understood his bowling, obviously coming through the ranks. He‚Äôs started using different set of skills, the wobble seam. ‚ÄúInitially, he had the ball coming into right-handers but now, he shapes the ball away. He has the ability and smartness to use the wobble seam and that also worked,‚Äù continued Mhambrey. Mhambrey was all praise for Jadeja‚Äôs accuracy, whereas he feels Kuldeep Yadav has improved on his technicality. ‚ÄúHis (Jadeja) ability is very simple. Ability to hit the deck, and hit the lengths spot on. Very accurate. Very miserly in terms of the way he goes about his bowling. Doesn‚Äôt give anything away to the batsman. ‚ÄúLove how Kuldeep has gone about over the last couple of years. He‚Äôs done little bit of technical adjustment to his run-up, which has really helped him to add those revs,‚Äù said Mhambrey. ‚ÄúHis spin has gone up, speed has gone up. And, someone like a chinaman bowler who does that, doesn‚Äôt allow you to step out so easily,‚Äù he added. Although Ravichandran Ashwin has played just the lone match against Australia in Chennai, where he finished with figures of 1/34, Mhambrey feels the all-rounder offers loads of experience to the team. ‚ÄúAsh (Ashwin) is out and out a match-winner. Love the way he moves about, no airs about playing the game or not playing the game. ‚ÄúEven when he‚Äôs sitting in the dugout when you have those chats with him, he‚Äôs always there to guide these guys and comes up with a lot of suggestions,‚Äù commented the former cricketer. Join our Whatsapp channel to get the latest global news updates Published on: November 13, 2023 23:41:56 IST Tags: Cricket Paras Mhambrey Team India World Cup 2023

newsArray.title: Cricket Legends Virender Sehwag, Diana Edulji, and Aravinda de Silva Inducted into ICC Cricket Hall of Fame
creator: OdAdmin
newsArray.description: Three cricketing greats and standout performers in the history of the game ‚Äì legendary opener Virender Sehwag, former Indian Women Test skipper Diana Edulji and Sri Lanka‚Äôs iconic star Aravinda de Silva are the latest inductees to be added to the ICC Cricket Hall of Fame. The International Cricket Council (ICC) today announced the name [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: Three cricketing greats and standout performers in the history of the game ‚Äì legendary opener Virender Sehwag, former Indian Women Test skipper Diana Edulji and Sri Lanka‚Äôs iconic star Aravinda de Silva are the latest inductees to be added to the ICC Cricket Hall of Fame. The International Cricket Council (ICC) today announced the name of the three legends of cricket as the latest inductees. Sehwag, a destructive opener of the modern era, holds a record that is still hard to match, the first Indian with a two Triple centuries. The second inductee Edulji captained India for almost three decades, and as a left-arm orthodox spinner claimed 100 wickets while making 54 international appearances. Edulji took up the role of administrator with Western Railways and worked hard to create opportunities for employment for women cricketers. The third inductee was a winner of the ICC Men‚Äôs Cricket World Cup with Sri Lanka in 1996 ‚Äì Aravinda de Silva. The Sri Lankan batter was known for his consistency, scoring 20 Test centuries during an 18-year international career which is the third most by any Sri Lanka men‚Äôs player. The ICC Hall of Fame honours the greatest international cricketers throughout the long history of the sport, and the enduring legacies of de Silva, Edulji and Sehwag see them join as inductees number 110, 111 and 112 respectively. As part of this year‚Äôs celebrations, the Class of 2023 will be inducted in a special on-field ceremony at the Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai during the first semi-final of the ICC Men‚Äôs Cricket World Cup 2023 on November 15.

The International Cricket Council (ICC) today announced the name [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: Three cricketing greats and standout performers in the history of the game ‚Äì legendary opener Virender Sehwag, former Indian Women Test skipper Diana Edulji and Sri Lanka‚Äôs iconic star Aravinda de Silva are the latest inductees to be added to the ICC Cricket Hall of Fame. The International Cricket Council (ICC) today announced the name of the three legends of cricket as the latest inductees. Sehwag, a destructive opener of the modern era, holds a record that is still hard to match, the first Indian with a two Triple centuries. The second inductee Edulji captained India for almost three decades, and as a left-arm orthodox spinner claimed 100 wickets while making 54 international appearances. The third inductee was a winner of the ICC Men‚Äôs Cricket World Cup with Sri Lanka in 1996 ‚Äì Aravinda de Silva. The Sri Lankan batter was known for his consistency, scoring 20 Test centuries during an 18-year international career which is the third most by any Sri Lanka men‚Äôs player. The ICC Hall of Fame honours the greatest international cricketers throughout the long history of the sport, and the enduring legacies of de Silva, Edulji and Sehwag see them join as inductees number 110, 111 and 112 respectively. newsArray.description: EXCLUSIVE INTERVIEW BY LAWRENCE BOOTH: Duckett, who has been at the heart of England's Bazball revolution in Test cricket, intends to show what he can do in 50-over cricket.
newsArray.content: England batter Ben Duckett out to seize his big chance to impress in the Caribbean after watching his 'tired' team-mates struggle at the World Cup A new-look England will face the West Indies in three ODIs next month Ben Duckett hopes to add to the eight one-day caps he has won in seven years The 29-year-old has been at the heart of the Bazball revolution in Test cricket By Lawrence Booth for the Daily Mail Published: 20:01, 13 November 2023 | Updated: 20:37, 13 November 2023 e-mail View comments A refreshed Ben Duckett wants to take the Caribbean by storm next month after watching his ‚Äòtired‚Äô team-mates struggle at the World Cup in India . Duckett, who has been at the heart of England‚Äôs Bazball revolution in Test cricket, intends to show what he can do in 50-over cricket when a new four-year World Cup cycle begins with the first of three ODIs against West Indies in Antigua on December 3. And he believes the simplicity of his approach, which essentially remains unaltered whatever the format, will stand him in good stead as he looks to add to the eight one-day caps he has won since his debut in Bangladesh seven years ago. ‚ÄòI‚Äôve been a part of the best generation of England white-ball cricket and it‚Äôs been near to impossible to break into the team,‚Äô he told Mail Sport. ‚ÄòNow there‚Äôs an opportunity to go and get my place.‚Äô Managing director Rob Key said on Sunday he felt England‚Äôs one-day team had not been helped by comparisons with the aggressive Bazballers. And with many of the 30-somethings who have fallen so short in India being omitted from the trip to the Caribbean, a new-look one-day side will include the Test-match top three of Duckett, Zak Crawley and Ollie Pope. England batter Ben Duckett wants to take the Caribbean by storm next month Once, England used the one-day team as the route into Test cricket. Then, under Ben Stokes and Brendon McCullum, the Test side copied their one-day counterparts‚Äô aggression. Now, with Key observing that the 50-over team has gone away from the style that helped make England double white-ball world champions, it is as if the wheel has turned full circle. The 29-year-old Duckett hesitates to call himself young, but admits: ‚ÄòThe exciting brand that the likes of me, Zak and Popey play is exactly what England want in both formats. It will be an opportunity for some fresh faces to go and show what they can do. ‚ÄòI‚Äôve always found I don‚Äôt have a different gameplan for Test match, 50-over and T20. In the past I‚Äôd always say you just take a few more risks in T20, whereas now I‚Äôm running at Josh Hazlewood in a Test match on day one. ‚ÄòThere‚Äôs also Harry Brook, Will Jacks and Phil Salt - there are so many names. All those guys are playing a similar brand of cricket throughout the formats, which makes life a lot easier.‚Äô Duckett does not believe that the squad for the Caribbean spells the end for England‚Äôs Class of 2019, and says the selectors were always going to look elsewhere for a trip that starts so soon after the World Cup. He says he was told he was ‚Äòpretty close‚Äô to selection for the tournament himself, and found it ‚Äòtough‚Äô to watch England lose six games out of nine. The 29-year-old has been at the heart of England‚Äôs Bazball revolution in Test cricket ‚ÄòI‚Äôm sure the lads are more gutted than anyone,‚Äô he said. ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs a side that were good enough to go and win. I‚Äôm looking at half or three-quarters of that squad, and the timing being straight after the English summer. All the lads have been playing so much cricket. ‚ÄòI felt for them flying straight off at the end of the summer, with no break, going straight to a World Cup in India. It must have been incredibly hard, and there must have been tired bodies.‚Äô Duckett, by contrast, has had six weeks off after the end of a summer in which he opened in all five Ashes Tests and made an unbeaten 107 off 78 balls in an ODI against Ireland in Bristol. ‚ÄòI‚Äôve had a really nice break, and I feel fresh and ready to go.‚Äô Music, after the last few weeks, to English ears. India India Cricket Share or comment on this article: England batter Ben Duckett out to seize his big chance to impress in the Caribbean after watching his 'tired' team-mates struggle at the World Cup e-mail Add comment Comments 0 Share what you think No comments have so far been submitted. newsArray.title: World Cup 2023: Morne Morkel resigns as Pakistan bowling coach following team's disappointing performance
creator: PN Vishnu
newsArray.description: World Cup 2023: Morne Morkel resigns as Pakistan bowling coach following team's disappointing performance
newsArray.content: Cricket World Cup 2023: Morne Morkel resigns as Pakistan bowling coach following team's disappointing performance Morne Morkel had joined Pakistan cricket team on a six-month contract in June this year after finishing his assignment with IPL side Lucknow Super Giants. Press Trust of India November 14, 2023 00:03:38 IST Morne Morkel had joined the team on a six-month contract in June this year after finishing his assignment with IPL side Lucknow Super Giants. AP Lahore: Former South African pacer Morne Morkel on Monday resigned as the Pakistan cricket team‚Äôs bowling coach without completing his contract and two days after the team‚Äôs elimination from the World Cup in India. World Cup 2023: News | Schedule | Results | Points table The Babar Azam-led Pakistan lost five of the nine matches in the ODI showpiece event, losing the last match to England by 93 runs in Kolkata. Related Articles World Cup 2023: Pakistan have not been paid for five months, claims Rashid Latif World Cup 2023: What are Pakistan's semi-final chances after beating Bangladesh? Morkel had joined the team on a six-month contract in June this year after finishing his assignment with IPL side Lucknow Super Giants. His first assignment with the Pakistan team was its tour of Sri Lanka for a two-Test series. ‚ÄúPakistan Cricket Board will announce his replacement in due course. Pakistan‚Äôs next assignment is a three-match Test series against Australia scheduled to take place from December 14, 2023, to January 7, 2024, in Australia,‚Äù the PCB said in a statement on Monday. Former fast bowler Umar Gul is tipped to replace Morkel as he has worked before with the national team on an interim basis and has also coached the Afghanistan team. Pakistan failed to qualify for the semifinals after finishing fifth, which led to several former cricketers demanding wholesale changes in the side, including the removal of Babar Azam as skipper . Pakistan suffered losses against India, Australia, South Africa, England and a shock defeat at the hands of Afghanistan. newsArray.title: World Cup 2023: We have the right bowlers to exploit different conditions, says India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey
creator: PN Vishnu
newsArray.description: World Cup 2023: We have the right bowlers to exploit different conditions, says India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey
newsArray.content: Cricket World Cup 2023: We have the right bowlers to exploit different conditions, says India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey ‚ÄúIn terms of the different skills, we have the ability to (take on) whatever challenge that is ahead of us. Maybe different surfaces, we have the bowlers to do that. And we‚Äôve done it,‚Äù India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey said. FirstCricket Staff November 13, 2023 23:41:56 IST Paras Mhambrey was all praise for Jasprit Bumrah, calling him a "lethal" bowler. AP India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey believes that the hosts have the right bowlers who can be effective on different conditions and surfaces. World Cup 2023: News | Schedule | Results | Points table The Indian bowlers have taken the 2023 World Cup by storm so far, with the pace trio of Mohammed Shami, Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj sharing 45 wickets between themselves. Apart from the pacers, Ravindra Jadeja (16 wickets) and Kuldeep Yadav (14 wickets) have also been equally impressive. Related Articles World Cup 2023: Team India reach Mumbai ahead of semi-final against New Zealand; Coaching staff inspects Wankhede pitch World Cup 2023: Hardik Pandya ruled out of tournament; Prasidh Krishna named replacement India‚Äôs impeccable bowling attack has helped the hosts remain unbeaten in the World Cup so far, having clinched nine wins in as many matches. ‚ÄúIn terms of the different skills, we have the ability to (take on) whatever challenge that is ahead of us. Maybe different surfaces, we have the bowlers to do that. And we‚Äôve done it,‚Äù Mhambrey told ICC following India‚Äôs 160-run win over Netherlands on Sunday. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre the only team who are going to play in nine different venues. So for us, it‚Äôs nine different surfaces, nine different challenges. ‚ÄúSo, we have the right bowlers to exploit these conditions, and they‚Äôve shown that. All of them on a given day can win a game for their country,‚Äù stated Mhambrey. Mhambrey went onto term Jasprit Bumrah as a ‚Äúlethal‚Äù bowler whereas he complemented Shami‚Äôs seam bowling. ‚ÄúBoom (Bumrah) is a very different action. Just look at the way he‚Äôs come back to the game (from injury). The set of skills, the unique action. He completely beats you. Now, he‚Äôs got both. He gets the ball in and gets the ball out. He‚Äôs become lethal,‚Äù the coach said. ‚ÄúShami is someone who has the seam (that hits) straight upright. You never know when Shami hits that seam, which way it‚Äôs going to come,‚Äù added the 51-year-old. Mhambrey also noted Siraj‚Äôs versatility, saying: ‚ÄúSiraj has really kind of grown in the last couple of years. He‚Äôs understood his bowling, obviously coming through the ranks. He‚Äôs started using different set of skills, the wobble seam. ‚ÄúInitially, he had the ball coming into right-handers but now, he shapes the ball away. He has the ability and smartness to use the wobble seam and that also worked,‚Äù continued Mhambrey. Mhambrey was all praise for Jadeja‚Äôs accuracy, whereas he feels Kuldeep Yadav has improved on his technicality. ‚ÄúHis (Jadeja) ability is very simple. Ability to hit the deck, and hit the lengths spot on. Very accurate. Very miserly in terms of the way he goes about his bowling. Doesn‚Äôt give anything away to the batsman. ‚ÄúLove how Kuldeep has gone about over the last couple of years. He‚Äôs done little bit of technical adjustment to his run-up, which has really helped him to add those revs,‚Äù said Mhambrey. ‚ÄúHis spin has gone up, speed has gone up. And, someone like a chinaman bowler who does that, doesn‚Äôt allow you to step out so easily,‚Äù he added. Although Ravichandran Ashwin has played just the lone match against Australia in Chennai, where he finished with figures of 1/34, Mhambrey feels the all-rounder offers loads of experience to the team. ‚ÄúAsh (Ashwin) is out and out a match-winner. Love the way he moves about, no airs about playing the game or not playing the game. ‚ÄúEven when he‚Äôs sitting in the dugout when you have those chats with him, he‚Äôs always there to guide these guys and comes up with a lot of suggestions,‚Äù commented the former cricketer. newsArray.title: Cricket Legends Virender Sehwag, Diana Edulji, and Aravinda de Silva Inducted into ICC Cricket Hall of Fame
creator: OdAdmin
newsArray.description: Three cricketing greats and standout performers in the history of the game ‚Äì legendary opener Virender Sehwag, former Indian Women Test skipper Diana Edulji and Sri Lanka‚Äôs iconic star Aravinda de Silva are the latest inductees to be added to the ICC Cricket Hall of Fame. The International Cricket Council (ICC) today announced the name [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: Three cricketing greats and standout performers in the history of the game ‚Äì legendary opener Virender Sehwag, former Indian Women Test skipper Diana Edulji and Sri Lanka‚Äôs iconic star Aravinda de Silva are the latest inductees to be added to the ICC Cricket Hall of Fame. The International Cricket Council (ICC) today announced the name of the three legends of cricket as the latest inductees. Sehwag, a destructive opener of the modern era, holds a record that is still hard to match, the first Indian with a two Triple centuries. The second inductee Edulji captained India for almost three decades, and as a left-arm orthodox spinner claimed 100 wickets while making 54 international appearances. Edulji took up the role of administrator with Western Railways and worked hard to create opportunities for employment for women cricketers. The third inductee was a winner of the ICC Men‚Äôs Cricket World Cup with Sri Lanka in 1996 ‚Äì Aravinda de Silva. The Sri Lankan batter was known for his consistency, scoring 20 Test centuries during an 18-year international career which is the third most by any Sri Lanka men‚Äôs player. The ICC Hall of Fame honours the greatest international cricketers throughout the long history of the sport, and the enduring legacies of de Silva, Edulji and Sehwag see them join as inductees number 110, 111 and 112 respectively. As part of this year‚Äôs celebrations, the Class of 2023 will be inducted in a special on-field ceremony at the Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai during the first semi-final of the ICC Men‚Äôs Cricket World Cup 2023 on November 15.

newsArray.title: Australian cricketer‚Äôs incredible six wickets in final six balls wins match
